summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 discussing protocol for handling potential victim and witness calls related to the Epstein investigation. The main email expresses that a caller (likely law enforcement) insisted that any leads from witnesses reaching out directly must be sent to the FBI for follow-up, and the team plans to discuss their response.

events.title: Call about victim/witness protocol
events.description: A law enforcement official called to discuss the protocol for handling victim calls and insisted that any witness leads reaching out directly must be sent to the FBI.

events.title: CSOs receive call about Epstein information
events.description: The CSOs (likely Criminal Section Officers) received a telephone call from a female who identified herself as having information about Epstein.

keyFacts: In July 2019, law enforcement was actively managing protocols for returning calls to potential victims of Epstein.
A law enforcement official was adamant that any witness leads reaching out directly to the team must be sent to the FBI for follow-up, indicating coordination issues.
The CSOs received a call from a female claiming to have information about Epstein, showing ongoing public tips.
The email chain reflects internal team discussion about how to properly handle sensitive witness information during the investigation.
